item.title: Shortening Code [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“relmitos, post:4, topic:316810”]Could make a new class for cooking instead, then it won’t use much space in your client class.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 28, 2009, 07:01:47 am[/size][hr]Or try something like this

	public void cook(int skillAdd, int item1, int item2, int cooked, int skillNeeded) {
		addSkillXP(skillAdd,cooking);
		sM("It smells delicious.");
	    deleteItem(item1, getItemSlot(item1), 1);
	    deleteItem(item2, getItemSlot(item2), 1);
	    addItem(cooked, 1);
	}

You can call it like this:

if(itemUsed == item1 && otherItem == item2){ cook(expGained, item1, item2, PIZZA, expNeeded); } [/quote]

public void cook(int skillAdd, int item1, int item2, int cooked, int skillNeeded, String msg) { if(playerLevel[playerCooking] < skillNeeded) { sendMessage("You need "+skillNeeded+" to cook a "+getItemName(cooked)+"."); return; } addSkillXP(skillAdd,cooking); sM("It smells delicious."); deleteItem(item1, getItemSlot(item1), 1); deleteItem(item2, getItemSlot(item2), 1); addItem(cooked, 1); sendMessage(msg); }

Read full topic

item.title: Shortening Code [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

[quote=“relmitos, post:4, topic:316810”]Could make a new class for cooking instead, then it won’t use much space in your client class.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 28, 2009, 07:01:47 am[/size][hr]Or try something like this

	public void cook(int skillAdd, int item1, int item2, int cooked, int skillNeeded) {
		addSkillXP(skillAdd,cooking);
		sM("It smells delicious.");
	    deleteItem(item1, getItemSlot(item1), 1);
	    deleteItem(item2, getItemSlot(item2), 1);
	    addItem(cooked, 1);
	}

You can call it like this:

if(itemUsed == item1 && otherItem == item2){ cook(expGained, item1, item2, PIZZA, expNeeded); } [/quote]

Good ideas. Yet I don’t see why you need to shorten it TBH.

Read full topic

item.title: Shortening Code [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

Could make a new class for cooking instead, then it won’t use much space in your client class.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 28, 2009, 07:01:47 am[/size][hr]Or try something like this

	public void cook(int skillAdd, int item1, int item2, int cooked, int skillNeeded) {
		addSkillXP(skillAdd,cooking);
		sM("It smells delicious.");
	    deleteItem(item1, getItemSlot(item1), 1);
	    deleteItem(item2, getItemSlot(item2), 1);
	    addItem(cooked, 1);
	}

You can call it like this:

if(itemUsed == item1 && otherItem == item2){
     cook(expGained, item1, item2, PIZZA, expNeeded);
}

Read full topic

item.title: Shortening Code [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @Keegan1 Keegan_
item.description:
@Keegan1 wrote:

Hey how do I shorten this code //Pizzas if ((itemUsed == 1933) && (useWith == 1929) || (itemUsed == 1929) && (useWith == 1933)) { deleteItem(1933, getItemSlot(1933), 1); deleteItem(1929, getItemSlot(1929), 1); addItem(2283, 1); addSkillXP(80, 7); sM("You make some dough."); } if ((itemUsed == 1933) && (useWith == 1921) || (itemUsed == 1921) && (useWith == 1933)) { deleteItem(1933, getItemSlot(1933), 1); deleteItem(1921, getItemSlot(1921), 1); addItem(2283, 1); addSkillXP(80, 7); sM("You make some dough."); } if ((itemUsed == 1933) && (useWith == 1937) || (itemUsed == 1937) && (useWith == 1933)) { deleteItem(1933, getItemSlot(1933), 1); deleteItem(1937, getItemSlot(1937), 1); addItem(2283, 1); addSkillXP(80, 7); sM("You make some dough."); } if ((itemUsed == 2283) && (useWith == 1982) || (itemUsed == 1982) && (useWith == 2283)) { if (playerLevel[7] >= 35) { deleteItem(2283, getItemSlot(2283), 1); deleteItem(1982, getItemSlot(1982), 1); addItem(2285, 1); addSkillXP(80, 7); sM("You add tomato to the pizza"); } else { sM("You need 35 cooking to add to the pizza."); } } if ((itemUsed == 2285) && (useWith == 1985) || (itemUsed == 1985) && (useWith == 2285)) { if (playerLevel[7] >= 35) { deleteItem(2285, getItemSlot(2285), 1); deleteItem(1985, getItemSlot(1985), 1); addItem(2287, 1); addSkillXP(80, 7); sM("You add cheeze to the pizza"); } else { sM("You need 35 cooking to add to the pizza."); } } if ((itemUsed == 2287) && (useWith == 2134) || (itemUsed == 2134) && (useWith == 2287)) { if (playerLevel[7] >= 45) { deleteItem(2287, getItemSlot(2287), 1); deleteItem(2134, getItemSlot(2134), 1); addItem(2293, 1); addSkillXP(80, 7); sM("You add raw rat meat to the pizza"); } else { sM("You need 45 cooking to make a meat pizza."); } } if ((itemUsed == 2287) && (useWith == 2136) || (itemUsed == 2136) && (useWith == 2287)) { if (playerLevel[7] >= 45) { deleteItem(2287, getItemSlot(2287), 1); deleteItem(2136, getItemSlot(2136), 1); addItem(2293, 1); addSkillXP(80, 7); sM("You add raw bear meat to the pizza"); } else { sM("You need 45 cooking to make a meat pizza."); } } if ((itemUsed == 2287) && (useWith == 2132) || (itemUsed == 2132) && (useWith == 2287)) { if (playerLevel[7] >= 45) { deleteItem(2287, getItemSlot(2287), 1); deleteItem(2132, getItemSlot(2132), 1); addItem(2293, 1); addSkillXP(80, 7); sM("You add raw beef to the pizza"); } else { sM("You need 45 cooking to make a meat pizza."); } } if ((itemUsed == 2287) && (useWith == 321) || (itemUsed == 321) && (useWith == 2287)) { if (playerLevel[7] >= 55) { deleteItem(2287, getItemSlot(2287), 1); deleteItem(321, getItemSlot(321), 1); addItem(2297, 1); addSkillXP(80, 7); sM("You add raw anchovies to the pizza"); } else { sM("You need 55 cooking to make a anchovy pizza."); } } if ((itemUsed == 2287) && (useWith == 2116) || (itemUsed == 2116) && (useWith == 2287)) { if (playerLevel[7] >= 65) { deleteItem(2287, getItemSlot(2287), 1); deleteItem(2116, getItemSlot(2116), 1); addItem(2301, 1); addSkillXP(80, 7); sM("You add pineapple chunks to the pizza"); } else { sM("You need 65 cooking to make a pineapple pizza."); } } //End of Pizzas Considering this is just pizzas I have to do all combination foods and I don’t want that much space taken up. I am pretty sure you can shorten this code but can somebody explain how?

Read full topic
